title: Guanano (2010) New Testament
description: Guanano (Wanano), or Piratapuyo, is a Tucanoan language spoken in the northwest part of Amazonas in Brazil and in Vaup√©s in Colombia. It is spoken by two peoples, the Wanano [es] and the Piratapuyo. They do not intermarry, but their speech is 75% lexically similar.
